net.alevel.asteroids.engine.graphics

Class Mesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.alevel.asteroids.engine.graphics.Mesh

  • public class Mesh
extends Object
    Stores data about the object's shape (i.e. the position of vertices) and also the object's texture and normal vectors (to be used for lighting mechanics mainly) It stores the references to the 4 buffers that belong to this mesh.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mesh(float[] positions, float[] textCoords, float[] normals, int[] indices)
      Creates a new Mesh object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mesh

        public Mesh(float[] positions,
            float[] textCoords,
            float[] normals,
            int[] indices)
        Creates a new Mesh object. These 4 arrays will also be loaded onto the GPU.
        Parameters:
        positions - Vertex positions (model positions)
        textCoords - Coords to be used to align the texture to the mesh
        normals - Normal vectors for each position vertex
        indices - Used to work out which position vertices make up which triangles

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render()
        Called by Renderer.render(net.alevel.asteroids.engine.Window, Camera, List) to bind the VBOs (tell OpenGL to use 'these' VBOs) so the renderer knows what to draw

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Destroys all VBOs and the VAO. This should be run when the mesh is no longer needed so there is no wasted memory on the GPU

      • isTextured

        public boolean isTextured()
        Checks if the mesh has a texture associated with it
        Returns:
        true if it does
